title: Wire Broadcaster to push real-time events to connected clients
description:
Phase 1 Success Criteria #2: "See events from other connected characters in same location"

The Broadcaster component exists but isn't wired to push events to connected clients in real-time.

## Current State
- Broadcaster exists in internal/core with Subscribe/Publish
- ConnectionHandler processes commands and sends responses
- Events are persisted to EventStore
- Events are replayed on reconnect

## Missing
- When a character does `say` or `pose`, other connected characters in the same location don't see it in real-time
- Need to wire: Engine -> Broadcaster -> ConnectionHandlers

## Implementation
1. ConnectionHandler subscribes to location stream on connect
2. Engine publishes events to Broadcaster after persisting
3. Broadcaster delivers to all subscribed ConnectionHandlers
4. ConnectionHandler.sendEvent() formats and sends to client

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Two telnet clients connected to same location
- [ ] Client A does `say hello`
- [ ] Client B sees the message in real-time (not just on reconnect)
- [ ] Works for both say and pose events
close_reason: Completed in commit 563024e

- Plugin can emit events back to the game

title: Add mTLS gRPC control port for admin operations
description:
Add an mTLS-authenticated gRPC port for control operations.

**Operations:**
- Shutdown (graceful stop)
- Status (detailed process info)  
- Reload (future: reload config)
- Drain (future: stop accepting new connections)

**Requirements:**
- Add `--control-grpc-addr` flag (e.g., `--control-grpc-addr=:9091`)
- Require mTLS client certificate authentication
- Reuse existing TLS certificates from `internal/tls`
- Both core and gateway processes
- Define proto in `internal/proto/holomush/control/v1/control.proto`
- Update `holomush status` to use gRPC instead of Unix socket

**Why mTLS gRPC:**
- Control operations need authentication (shutdown is destructive)
- gRPC provides typed interface and streaming
- Consistent with core↔gateway communication pattern
- Supports remote administration securely
close_reason: mTLS gRPC control port for admin operations

title: Control gRPC authentication with special client cert or admin privileges
description:
The control gRPC interface needs proper authentication. Options:
1. Special client certificate issued only for control operations
2. User authentication with system admin privileges

Currently the control interface uses the same mTLS certs as the main gRPC communication, which means any component with valid certs can control (shutdown) any process.

title: CRITICAL: gRPC server goroutine swallows errors
description:
## Problem
`Start()` in `internal/control/grpc_server.go:62-69` returns nil immediately after launching goroutine. Server failures are logged but not propagated to caller.

## Location
`internal/control/grpc_server.go:62-69`

## Hidden Errors
- TLS handshake failures
- Network binding failures after initial Listen() succeeds
- gRPC protocol-level errors

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Write a test that proves the bug exists (server error not visible to caller)

title: Refactor runCore/runGateway for testability via dependency injection
description:
## Problem
`runCore()` and `runGateway()` have low test coverage (10-14%) because they're monolithic functions with hardcoded dependencies:
- Database connections (PostgreSQL)
- TLS certificate loading
- gRPC server creation
- Observability server creation
- Signal handling

Current cmd/holomush coverage: 54.6%

## Solution
Refactor using dependency injection pattern to allow mocking in tests.

## Implementation Approach
1. Define interfaces for external dependencies:
   - EventStoreFactory
   - TLSLoader
   - GRPCServerFactory
   - ObservabilityServerFactory

2. Create a `CoreDeps` struct for runCore dependencies
3. Create a `GatewayDeps` struct for runGateway dependencies
4. Modify run functions to accept deps (with sensible defaults for production)
5. Write tests using mock implementations

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Dependencies are injectable via struct or functional options
- [ ] Mock implementations exist for all external dependencies
- [ ] Tests cover happy path and error paths for runCore
- [ ] Tests cover happy path and error paths for runGateway
- [ ] cmd/holomush test coverage exceeds 80%
- [ ] Existing tests continue to pass
- [ ] `task lint` passes
- [ ] `task test` passes
- [ ] Code reviewed by separate agent using pr-review-toolkit:code-reviewer

description:
Add a plain HTTP port for Prometheus and Kubernetes integration.

**Endpoints:**
- `/metrics` - Prometheus metrics (connection counts, request latency, etc.)
- `/healthz/liveness` - Kubernetes liveness probe (process is running)
- `/healthz/readiness` - Kubernetes readiness probe (ready to accept connections)

**Requirements:**
- Add `--http-addr` flag (e.g., `--http-addr=:9090`)
- Plain HTTP (no TLS) - these endpoints don't need auth
- Both core and gateway processes
- Standard Prometheus exposition format

**Why plain HTTP:**
- Prometheus doesn't typically use mTLS for scraping
- Kubernetes probes work better with plain HTTP
- No secrets exposed on these endpoints
close_reason: HTTP observability port with /metrics and /healthz endpoints
